Articles.Content: i am excited for the prospect of using ksp2 to heat my house. also interstellar flight is nice.

I'm excited for the modding scene that KSP2 will bring, and for all of the future adventures in the Kerbal universe and beyond!

Edited February 22, 2023 by Misguided Kerbal
I’m gonna steal NASA’s computer to run KSP2

I'm most excited for the new colonies system, improved graphics and hopefully more interesting ground features that incentivise exploration. I also would love better performance with increase part counts (no more CPU thread  idiling )

And finally slay the every KSP player worst enemy, the Kraken
Im exicted for KSP 2, like everything.  Sad I have to go on a trip on the release day.

I'm also excited about interstellar travel and colonies.exploring the vast universe using the cutting edge technology with our little green friend will definitely makes me happy!

Edited February 22, 2023 by jebycheek

I'm excited to share my excitement from when I first discovered KSP with my children, to bring them in on the ground floor for something I believe is more than just a game. I am excited to see just what KSP 2 will inspire, now that it is more than a super niche title. And I'm excited to explore the Kerbal universe.
I'm excited to see what communiy is capable of in terms of mods in this new engine, ksp 1 has very cool mods, ksp 2 has a bright future

I cannot wait for colonies, interstellar travel, and procedural wings! Got ksp1 in December because I was tired of waiting, and now the wait is finally over! The fact that you can construct vehicles in colonies is incredible for me. All my ksp1 sstos use b9 procedural wings and I can’t go back to the old wing system.
The revamped Kerbol System! (Specially Eve and Duna!)
Colonies and the potential for better performance with a new engine are by far the most exciting.
I'm excited to be able to follow the development of this game and see how it grows from the foundation that we'll be launching from this Friday.
I'm excited for the new graphics, and to make some impressive-looking spacecraft.
The entire game. Just all of it.
I am excited to have a fresh foundation to work with as a modder.  Some of the original code in the old KSP1 was really novice material, and I'm hoping KSP2 improves that.
I'm most exited for the procedural wings, if my brother was telling the truth about them.

1 minute ago, Kerbal410 said:

I'm most exited for the procedural wings, if my brother was telling the truth about them.

Yes, he was.

This may seem silly but I'm very excited for the procedural wings, I always hate making planes and SSTOs mostly because the wings aren't great, I think I will have a lot of fun building space planes in KSP 2.
I am really excited for the multiplayer in KSP 2. I am really loking forward to playing with friends and family together.
I'm glad there are proper tutorials so I don't have to drop links of 50 videos to get new players started when I suggest they play KSP.
Building "ships of the line" to send to other star systems is what I'm excited for. Finally, time to kill kerbals simply by standing next to a engine. Also, clouds, baby!
I'm excited for a new KSP.

I'm excited to just enjoy the journey of seeing this game get more developed with time.

I got KSP1 years after it first released, so I never really experienced stuff like 'red Moho' and 'solid water' until I watched a video showing these things off. I think watching development from the very beginning will be a nice, one-in-a-lifetime experience.
I am excited for the new contract system and science system.
I can't wait for the new planet systems! I wonder how the planets will look!
